home.title: Image Sorting and Renaming Tool
home.description: Professional online image sorting and renaming tool, supporting drag-and-drop sorting, multiple renaming rules, batch downloading, improving product image processing efficiency.
home.emptyState: Drag and drop images anywhere or double-click to select images

alerts.configUpload: Upload function requires upload service configuration
alerts.configComfyUI: Edit function requires ComfyUI service configuration
alerts.workflowProcess: Workflow processing requires ComfyUI service configuration

modals.workflowEmpty: No available workflows found, please create a workflow in ComfyUI first

status.configChanged: Configuration changed, will save automatically when focus is lost
status.accessFailed: Failed to get directory access permission

selectionInfo.aiModeTip: Use AI to generate filenames (AI service configuration required)

errors.saveImagesFailed: Failed to save image data, possibly due to large image size or lack of IndexedDB support.
errors.saveRenamedFailed: Failed to save renamed image data, possibly due to large image size or lack of IndexedDB support.
errors.missingGithubFields: Please fill in all required GitHub fields
errors.missingApiUrl: Please enter the custom server API URL

config.title: Image Upload Service Configuration
config.githubDesc: Upload images to a GitHub repository
config.customDesc: Upload to a custom API endpoint
config.githubTokenHelp: Requires a GitHub token with repo permissions.
config.githubPathInfo: Storage path will automatically use the prefix name of the image group, no manual configuration needed.
config.apiUrlHelp: API URL that receives image uploads
config.apiKeyHelp: Provide a key if your API requires authentication
config.comfyuiServerHelp: Default is http://localhost:8088. Modify if you're running ComfyUI on a different address or port.
config.workflowFolderHelp: Click the button above to select the folder on your local computer where ComfyUI workflows are stored. The system will open a file picker to select the actual workflow folder. You only need to authorize once, and the system will save this folder access permission to directly read all workflow files in that folder without needing to select it again.
config.corsInstructions: To solve cross-origin restrictions, follow these steps:
config.corsWarning: If you don't add the --enable-cors-header parameter, you'll encounter cross-origin errors and won't be able to communicate directly with ComfyUI!
config.accessFlowInfo: This application uses modern Web APIs to directly read workflow files on your computer. The access process is as follows:
config.authPersistenceInfo: Authorization is persistent and remains valid even after you close and reopen your browser. If you want to switch to a different workflow folder, simply click the "Change Authorized Directory" button and select a new folder.

stepsList.important: Important: You must add the --enable-cors-header parameter when starting ComfyUI
stepsList.setServer: Set the correct ComfyUI server address
stepsList.setFolder: Specify the local folder path where your ComfyUI workflow files are stored
stepsList.saveAndTest: Click "Save Configuration" and then test the connection

accessStepsList.selectFolder: In the file picker that appears, select the actual folder where your ComfyUI workflow files are stored
accessStepsList.remember: After authorization, the system will remember your selection and automatically read all JSON files in that folder
accessStepsList.scan: The system will scan the folder and all its subfolders for JSON files to use as workflows
